_header: This hardy fool this bird victorious
Title(s): Balade on a New Year’s Gift of an Eagle presented to King Henry VI in 1428
_description: John Lydgate, Balade on a New Year’s Gift of an Eagle presented to King Henry VI in 1428 — eleven stanzas rhyme royal and Envoy

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Þis hardy foole þis bridde victoryousÞis staately
                    foole mooste ImperyalOf his nature fiers and corageousCalled in
                    scripture þe foole celestyal…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…And to yow pryncesse he wol also þer beHelth and welfare
                    Ioye and prosparytee
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Þis balade was gyven vn to þe Kyng Henry þe vj and to his
                    moder þe qweene kateryne sittyng at þe mete vpon þe yeris day in
                    þe Castell of Hertford made by Ledegate (p. 149, of which ‘þe
                    vj’ is added by a later hand); Balade made to þe Kyng Henry and to
                    þe qwene Kateryne (RT)
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 649-51.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 88-90.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
THis hardy sowle this bridde victoriousThis stately sowle most
                    Imperial…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…And to yow pryncesse he wil also ther beHelth and welfare
                    Ioye and prosperyte
BLHar2251.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 213-16.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
This hardy foole this bryd victoryousthis stately fole moste
                    imperyall…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…and to youre pryncesse he woll also ther be.helth and
                    wellfare Ioye and prosperyte
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
this balade was gyuen vnto þe kyng henry and to hys moder the quene
                    kateryne sittyng at þe mete vpon the yeares day in the castell of hertford
                    made by lidgate & cetera (f. 145v)
